armors.name: Gambeson Armor
armors.description: Flexible: +1 to Evasion

armors.name: Chainmail Armor
armors.description: Heavy: −1 to Evasion

armors.name: Full Plate Armor
armors.description: Very Heavy: −2 to Evasion; −1 to Agility

armors.name: Improved Gambeson Armor
armors.description: Flexible: +1 to Evasion

armors.name: Improved Chainmail Armor
armors.description: Heavy: −1 to Evasion

armors.name: Improved Full Plate Armor
armors.description: Very Heavy: −2 to Evasion; −1 to Agility

armors.name: Elundrian Chain Armor
armors.description: Warded: You reduce incoming magic damage by your Armor Score before applying it to your damage thresholds.

armors.name: Harrowbone Armor
armors.description: Resilient: Before you mark your last Armor Slot, roll a d6. On a result of 6, reduce the severity by one threshold without marking an Armor Slot.

armors.name: Irontree Breastplate Armor
armors.description: Reinforced: When you mark your last Armor Slot, increase your damage thresholds by +2 until you clear at least 1 Armor Slot.

armors.name: Runetan Floating Armor
armors.description: Shifting: When you are targeted for an attack, you can mark an Armor Slot to give the attack roll against you disadvantage.

armors.name: Tyris Soft Armor
armors.description: Quiet: You gain a +2 bonus to rolls you make to move silently.

armors.name: Rosewild Armor
armors.description: Hopeful: When you would spend a Hope, you can mark an Armor Slot instead.

armors.name: Advanced Gambeson Armor
armors.description: Flexible: +1 to Evasion

armors.name: Advanced Chainmail Armor
armors.description: Heavy: −1 to Evasion

armors.name: Advanced Full Plate Armor
armors.description: Very Heavy: −2 to Evasion; −1 to Agility

armors.name: Bellamoi Fine Armor
armors.description: Gilded: +1 to Presence

armors.name: Dragonscale Armor
armors.description: Impenetrable: Once per short rest, when you would mark your last Hit Point, you can instead mark a Stress.

armors.name: Spiked Plate Armor
armors.description: Sharp: On a successful attack against a target within Melee range, add a d4 to the damage roll.

armors.name: Bladefare Armor
armors.description: Physical: You can’t mark an Armor Slot to reduce magic damage.

armors.name: Monett’s Cloak
armors.description: Magic: You can’t mark an Armor Slot to reduce physical damage.

armors.name: Runes of Fortification
armors.description: Painful: Each time you mark an Armor Slot, you must mark a Stress.

armors.name: Legendary Gambeson Armor
armors.description: Flexible: +1 to Evasion

armors.name: Legendary Chainmail Armor
armors.description: Heavy: −1 to Evasion

armors.name: Legendary Full Plate Armor
armors.description: Very Heavy: −2 to Evasion; −1 to Agility

armors.name: Dunamis Silkchain
armors.description: Timeslowing: Mark an Armor Slot to roll a d4 and add its result as a bonus to your Evasion against an incoming attack.

armors.name: Channeling Armor
armors.description: Channeling: +1 to Spellcast Rolls

armors.name: Emberwoven Armor
armors.description: Burning: When an adversary attacks you within Melee range, they mark a Stress.

armors.name: Full Fortified Armor
armors.description: Fortified: When you mark an Armor Slot, you reduce the severity of an attack by two thresholds instead of one.

armors.name: Veritas Opal Armor
armors.description: Truthseeking: This armor glows when another creature within Close range tells a lie.

armors.name: Savior Chainmail
armors.description: Difficult: −1 to all character traits and Evasion
